DataElement.preferredName: Leiomyosarcoma and Endometrial Stromal Sarcoma American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC) Edition 7 Pathologic Tumor T Stage
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Extent of the primary leiomyosarcoma and endometrial stromal sarcoma based on evidence obtained from pathologic examination through completion of definitive surgery.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Leiomyosarcoma and Endometrial Stromal Sarcoma Pathologic T Stage
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A malignant mesenchymal tumor arising from the wall of the uterine corpus (uterine body).  The most representative examples are leiomyosarcoma and endometrial stromal sarcoma. -- 2004_Caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology._One criteria of the TMN staging system.  T refers to the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A malignant mesenchymal tumor arising from the wall of the uterine corpus (uterine body).  The most representative examples are leiomyosarcoma and endometrial stromal sarcoma. -- 2004

Concepts.definition: A malignant mesenchymal neoplasm arising from the wall of the uterine corpus (uterine body).  The most representative examples are leiomyosarcoma and endometrial stromal sarcoma.

Property.preferredDefinition: Pathologic; caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology.:One criteria of the TMN staging system.  T refers to the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion).

Concepts.definition: Caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology.
One criteria of the TNM staging system. T refers to the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for CRF standard harmonization. Released per final community approval. mc 5/7/12

ValueDomain.preferredName: Leiomyosarcoma and Endometrial Stromal Sarcoma American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC) Edition 7 T Stage
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A finding about one or more characteristics of leiomyosarcoma and endometrial stromal sarcoma, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v7 classification system._A group formed for the purpose of developing a system of clinical staging for cancer that is acceptable to the American medical profession and is compatible with other accepted classifications._One criteria of the TMN staging system.  T refers to the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion)._The extent of a cancer within the body, especially whether the disease has spread from the original site to other parts of the body.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Leiomyosarcoma and Endometrial Stromal Sarcoma pT0 TNM Finding v7
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: No evidence of primary tumor. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

Concepts.definition: No evidence of primary tumor. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Leiomyosarcoma and Endometrial Stromal Sarcoma pT1 TNM Finding v7

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Leiomyosarcoma and Endometrial Stromal Sarcoma pT1 TNM Finding v7
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Tumor limited to the uterus. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Leiomyosarcoma and Endometrial Stromal Sarcoma pT1 TNM Finding v7
Concepts.definition: Tumor limited to the uterus. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Tumor 5 cm or less in greatest dimension. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

Concepts.definition: Tumor 5 cm or less in greatest dimension. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Leiomyosarcoma and Endometrial Stromal Sarcoma TNM Finding v7 American Joint Committee on Cancer T Stage Stage
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A finding about one or more characteristics of leiomyosarcoma and endometrial stromal sarcoma, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v7 classification system.:A group formed for the purpose of developing a system of clinical staging for cancer that is acceptable to the American medical profession and is compatible with other accepted classifications.:One criteria of the TMN staging system.  T refers to the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion).:The extent of a cancer within the body, especially whether the disease has spread from the original site to other parts of the body.

Concepts.longName: Leiomyosarcoma and Endometrial Stromal Sarcoma TNM Finding v7
Concepts.definition: A finding about one or more characteristics of leiomyosarcoma and endometrial stromal sarcoma, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v7 classification system.
A group formed for the purpose of developing a system of clinical staging for cancer that is acceptable to the American medical profession and is compatible with other accepted classifications.
One criteria of the TNM staging system. T refers to the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion).
The extent of a cancer in the body.
